page.title: 09CHIPPERFLD RELIGION & SCHOOL
page.content: {RELIGION }St.Paul's Parish Church, like the Baptist Chapel, was built in the late 1830's.Roman Catholics, who worshipped in Boxmoor or Watford until 1928, now share St.Paul's on Sundays.Good Friday devotions were shared by Catholics and Anglicans in 1984 & 1985 . Baptists & Anglicans join for Sunday evening worship in January & August. Applications to build Catholic Church have been turned down through Green Belt Policies. {EDUCATION} The Church of England Junior & Infants' School, built to an award winning design in 1974, has 5 teachers & 111 pupils. 4 wedge-shaped inter-connecting classrooms are grouped with kitchen, offices & staff room around a circular, central hall. The old school built in flint & brick in 1848 has been converted into four attractive houses overlooking Common.
